episodeTitle: Rescue Ace! The New Destination is the Great Prison
description: Luffy learns from Nyon that Hancock is a Shichibukai and that the Marines are planning to execute his brother Ace at Marineford. He decides to save Ace from Impel Down before he's transported. When Hancock falls ill with love sickness after Luffy announces his departure, she agrees to help him reach Impel Down by accepting the Marine's call.

events.title: Luffy Entertains the Kuja with Gomu Gomu no Haragi
events.description: During a banquet on Amazon Lily, Luffy uses his Gomu Gomu no Haragi (Belly Talk) technique to entertain the Kuja warriors. He inflates his belly, draws a face on it, and makes it dance, delighting the women of Amazon Lily.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's ability to connect with people through humor and shows his integration into Kuja society before his departure.

events.title: Luffy Learns Hancock is a Shichibukai
events.description: Following the party, Elder Nyon reveals to Luffy that Boa Hancock holds the rank of Shichibukai (Warlord of the Sea), one of the Seven Warlords who work with the World Government. This explains her authority and influence.
events.significance: Provides crucial context for Hancock's power and position, and sets up the mechanism by which Luffy can reach Impel Down.

quotes.text: Hancock is one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, a Shichibukai.
quotes.speaker: Nyon
quotes.context: Nyon explains Hancock's status to Luffy

events.title: Marines Summon the Shichibukai for War
events.description: Nyon reads from a newspaper that the Marines have summoned all Seven Warlords of the Sea as they prepare to launch an all-out offensive against the Whitebeard Pirates. This marks the beginning of the Summit War.
events.significance: Establishes the impending conflict between the Marines and Whitebeard Pirates, setting the stage for the Marineford War arc. This is a world-changing event.

events.title: Luffy Learns of Ace's Scheduled Execution
events.description: Nyon reveals to Luffy that his brother Portgas D. Ace is scheduled to be executed at Marineford in five days. The Marines plan to use Ace as bait to lure out Whitebeard. Luffy is horrified to learn that Blackbeard was responsible for Ace's capture.
events.significance: This is the pivotal moment that changes Luffy's entire journey. Instead of reuniting with his crew, he must now rush to save his brother. This revelation drives the entire Impel Down and Marineford arcs.

quotes.text: Ace's execution is in five days at Marineford!
quotes.speaker: Nyon
quotes.context: Nyon reveals the shocking news about Ace's fate

events.title: Luffy Decides to Rescue Ace from Impel Down
events.description: After learning that Ace is held in Impel Down and will be executed in five days, Luffy makes a life-changing decision. Rather than reuniting with his crew at Sabaody Archipelago (which would take a week), he decides to go straight to Impel Down to rescue Ace before the execution.
events.significance: This decision fundamentally alters Luffy's journey and separates him from his crew for an extended period. It demonstrates Luffy's deep love for his brother and his willingness to risk everything to save him.

quotes.text: I'm sorry, everyone. I have to save Ace!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy apologizes to his absent crewmates as he decides to prioritize rescuing Ace

events.title: Introduction to Impel Down Prison
events.description: Nyon explains to Luffy that Ace is being held in Impel Down, the World Government's maximum security underwater prison where the world's most dangerous criminals are kept. She emphasizes how difficult it would be to infiltrate such a facility.
events.significance: Introduces the setting for the next major arc and establishes the enormous challenge Luffy faces in attempting to rescue Ace.

events.title: The Plan to Reach Impel Down via Marine Ship
events.description: Nyon tells Luffy that the only way to reach Impel Down in time is for Hancock to accept the Marines' summons. A Marine battleship is the fastest way to get there before Ace's execution. Luffy must convince Hancock to answer the call and smuggle him aboard.
events.significance: Establishes the mechanism by which Luffy will infiltrate Impel Down and sets up the need for Hancock's cooperation.

events.title: Hancock Develops Love Sickness
events.description: After Luffy announces he must leave the island, Hancock experiences strange symptoms - blushing, confusion, and physical pain. She picks up a glass, starts crying uncontrollably, and collapses to the floor, breathing heavily and in pain.
events.significance: Marks the beginning of Hancock's love sickness disease, a condition that has killed previous Amazon Lily empresses. This is the first time Hancock has ever fallen in love.

events.title: Nyon Explains the History of Love Sickness
events.description: Elder Nyon reveals to Luffy the tragic history of Amazon Lily's previous empresses who died from love sickness. When an empress falls in love but cannot be with their beloved, they experience unbearable pain and eventually die. Previous empresses died because they tried to suppress their feelings and remain on the island.
events.significance: Provides crucial backstory about Amazon Lily's culture and the danger Hancock now faces. Establishes that leaving with her beloved is the only cure for love sickness.

quotes.text: All the previous empresses fell in love but had to stay on the island. The pain from not being with their loved ones caused them to die.
quotes.speaker: Nyon
quotes.context: Nyon explains the fatal nature of love sickness

events.title: Hancock Shares Her Past with Luffy
events.description: Hancock tells Luffy the full story of how she and her sisters were enslaved by the Celestial Dragons when she was 12 years old. She reveals the slave marks on their backs and how they suffered for four years until Fisher Tiger freed them. This is deeply personal information she's never shared with anyone outside her sisters and Nyon.
events.significance: This confession represents Hancock's complete trust in Luffy and explains the trauma behind her hatred of men. It's a pivotal moment in their relationship.

quotes.text: The only ones I hate are the Celestial Dragons, not you.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's response after hearing Hancock's tragic past

events.title: Hancock Agrees to Help Luffy Reach Impel Down
events.description: Despite her illness and the risks involved, Hancock agrees to accept the Marines' summons and help Luffy reach Impel Down. She will answer the call as a Shichibukai and smuggle Luffy aboard the Marine ship, unknowingly curing her own love sickness by choosing to be with him.
events.significance: Solidifies Hancock's devotion to Luffy and enables the Impel Down arc. By choosing to leave with Luffy, she saves herself from the fate of previous empresses.

events.title: Hancock's Transportation via Yuda Sea Serpents
events.description: The episode shows Hancock's ship, the Perfume Yuda, being pulled by poisonous Yuda sea serpents. These creatures are so dangerous that even Sea Kings avoid them, making it possible to travel through the Calm Belt safely.
events.significance: Explains how the Kuja Pirates can traverse the Calm Belt and foreshadows how Luffy will travel to Impel Down.

quotes.text: Ace's execution is in five days at Marineford!
quotes.speaker: Nyon
quotes.context: Revealing the shocking news to Luffy

quotes.text: I'm sorry, everyone. I have to save Ace!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy apologizes to his absent crew as he prioritizes saving Ace

quotes.text: All the previous empresses fell in love but had to stay on the island. The pain from not being with their loved ones caused them to die.
quotes.speaker: Nyon
quotes.context: Explaining the fatal nature of love sickness

quotes.text: The only ones I hate are the Celestial Dragons, not you.
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's response after hearing Hancock's tragic past

themes.description: Luffy's willingness to abandon his plan to reunite with his crew demonstrates the strength of his bond with Ace and his readiness to sacrifice his own goals for family.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's decision to go to Impel Down symbolizes the power of familial bonds over personal ambition.

themes.description: Hancock's love sickness represents her first experience with romantic love and vulnerability. The disease that killed previous empresses demonstrates how dangerous it can be to suppress genuine emotions.
themes.symbolism: Love sickness symbolizes the conflict between duty (remaining as empress) and personal desire (following one's heart).

themes.description: Hancock sharing her traumatic past with Luffy, and Luffy's accepting response without judgment, creates a deep bond of trust between them.
themes.symbolism: The slave marks on Hancock's back represent her deepest shame, and sharing this with Luffy symbolizes complete trust.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy learns of his brother's impending execution and must choose between reuniting with his crew or attempting a dangerous rescue mission. His immediate decision to save Ace shows his unwavering loyalty to family.
keyActions: Entertains the Kuja with Gomu Gomu no Haragi
Accepts Hancock's traumatic past without judgment
quotes: I'm sorry, everyone. I have to save Ace!
The only ones I hate are the Celestial Dragons, not you.

characterSpotlights.role: Supporting character experiencing love for the first time
characterSpotlights.development: Hancock contracts love sickness after falling in love with Luffy. She shares her most traumatic secret with him and agrees to help him reach Impel Down, unknowingly saving her own life in the process.
keyActions: Shares her past enslavement with Luffy
Agrees to help Luffy reach Impel Down
Accepts the Marines' summons as a Shichibukai

characterSpotlights.development: Nyon serves as the voice of wisdom and exposition, explaining the political situation, Ace's danger, and the history of love sickness to both Luffy and the audience.
keyActions: Explains Impel Down and the plan to reach it
Shares the history of love sickness
quotes: Ace's execution is in five days at Marineford!
All the previous empresses fell in love but had to stay on the island. The pain from not being with their loved ones caused them to die.

mangaDifferences.difference: The Gomu Gomu no Haragi technique was not named in the manga but was given a name in the anime.

trivia.fact: This episode lacks an opening narration, which is unusual for the series.
The episode had a TV rating of 11.1% and ranked 6th for its timeslot in Japan.
This episode marks the transition point between the Amazon Lily Arc and the Impel Down Arc, as Luffy's decision to save Ace drives the next phase of the story.
The love sickness disease that affects Hancock is unique to the empresses of Amazon Lily and has claimed the lives of several previous rulers.
